title: Informatiker med fördjupad Snomed CT kunskap
description:
*Ser du att god verksamhets- och informationsarkitektur är en framgångsfaktor för att säkerställa digitaliseringens möjligheter i området framtidens hälso- och sjukvård?*
*Att arbeta hos oss på enheten Strategisk Informationshantering innebär att du tillsammans med oss är delaktig i ett paradigmskifte inom hälso- och sjukvård och i det nu pågående nationella digitaliseringsarbetet.*
 Vi söker nu en informatiker med Snomed CT expertis till enheten Strategisk informationshantering inom avdelningen Digitalisering och IT på hälso- och sjukvårdsförvaltningen.
   

  

 Här kommer du att arbeta med att omsätta verksamhetskrav till beskrivningar av den information som hanteras i och överförs mellan olika system och tjänster inom hälso- och sjukvård samt hur informationen ska förvaltas på ett säkert och ändamålsenligt sätt.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i olika projekt, stödja dem med expertkunskap och delta i förvaltningsarbetet.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Att arbeta på enheten Strategisk informationshantering innebär att du tillsammans med dina kollegor är delaktig i ett spännande och omfattande utvecklingsskede inom hälso- och sjukvård och du blir en del av det nu pågående nationella digitaliseringsarbetet. Vi som arbetar här drivs av en vilja att skapa ordning och reda samt att utveckla en stabil informationsinfrastruktur för att förbättra hälso- och sjukvården i Region Stockholm.
   

  

 Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdstimme och friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård. Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån har vi för att underlätta för dig att få ihop vardagen. Här kan du läsa mer om förmånerna i vårt kollektivavtal.
   

  

 Vi sitter på Lindhagensgatan 98. Hit tar du dig med tunnelbanans gröna eller blå linje samt med flera busslinjer.
   

  

**Mer om tjänsten**
 Informatikteamet på enheten består av sju personer och vi behöver nu bli fler. Därför stärker vi nu informatikteamet ytterligare och den roll vi söker kommer att vara delaktig i att forma Region Stockholms gemensamma informatikarbete. Via vår beredningsfunktion för informatikrådet arbetar vi med samtliga vårdgivare och med nationella organisationer och myndigheter för att skapa en regional informationsstruktur.
   

  

 Vi arbetar i tvärfunktionella team och du kommer att arbeta med andra informatiker, kravanalytiker, verksamhetsrepresentanter och lösningsarkitekter.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna omfattar bland annat:
   

  

* Expertstöd inom Snomed CT
* Förvaltning av informatiska leveranser som berör Snomed CT
* Omvärldsbevakning
* Deltagande i regionala och nationella forum inom Snomed CT


**Vem är du?**
 Som person är du en öppen, utåtriktad, lyhörd, ödmjuk problemlösare som trivs med att arbeta i team. Du är analytisk, metodisk, ansvarstagande, självgående och leveransinriktad. Det är också viktigt att du är öppen för förändring då verksamheten du kommer att vara verksam i kommer att fortsätta utvecklas under de kommande åren.
   

  

 För att passa för rollen har du:
   

  

* Examen inom informatik, systemvetenskap eller annan utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig
* Flerårig praktisk erfarenhet av uppdrag inom Snomed CT
* Snomed CT Authoring level 1 certifierad
* Minst 2 års yrkeserfarenhet från informatikområdet
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med olika vårdprofessioner
* Mycket god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift


 Det är av stort värde för vår verksamhet och därför en fördel om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet att arbeta inom hälso- och sjukvården
* Erfarenhet av förvaltning
* Kännedom om hälsoinformatikstandarder


**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som något för dig ser vi gärna att du söker så snart som möjligt. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. För en komplett ansökan räcker det med att bifoga ditt CV. När du ansöker kommer du att få besvara ett antal frågor, dessa ersätter personligt brev.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Region Stockholm med IDG Recruitment. Vid intresse eller frågor kontakta Fredrik Svensson, Rekryteringskonsult på 0760 22 82 56, fredrik.svensson@foundryco.com
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Tester kan komma att ingå i rekryteringsprocessen. Vi använder oss av Assessios tester MAP och Matrigma. MAP är en personlighetstest och Matrigma är ett problemlösningstest som båda bygger på arbetspsykologisk forskning. Testerna används som ett komplement till dina erfarenheter och kompetenser.
   

  

 Hälso- och sjukvårdsförvaltningen stödjer Region Stockholms politiska organisation för att invånarna i Stockholms län har tillgång till en god och säker hälso- och sjukvård samt tandvård. Det innebär att förvaltningen beställer och följer upp hälso- och sjukvård och tandvård för 75 miljarder kronor årligen. Förvaltningen ansvarar också för kunskapsstyrningsorganisationen i Region Stockholm, samt en rad funktioner som är avgörande för hälso- och sjukvårdssystemet, såsom smittskydd, vårdhygien, kris- och katastrofberedskap. Läs mer här
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/6702 | Kontakt: Fredrik Svensson, Rekryteringskonsult IDG 0760228256, | Facklig företrädare: Linnea Pettersson, SACO 08-12313142, Anne-Lie Vestlund, Vision 070-7375715, Thérèse Juvall, Akademikerförbundet SSR 08-12313942, Annie Velander, Vårdförbundet 08-12314329, | Publicerat: 2024-10-30 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-12-01

title: Senior Test Manager
description:
**Job ID: 25777**
 Are you interested in making a difference by coordinating a test environment in one of the largest European bank? We seek a Senior Quality Assurance Lead to lead and shape testing methods within an agile release train.
 





  
 





 At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.   
 



**About this opportunity** 






  
 





 Welcome to the QA Capital Management Team. As the Senior Quality Assurance Lead, you will work closely with the team to ensure hands-on management of quality assurance in Agile Release Trains (ARTs), while establishing and governing the test processes, test people, test enablers, and test automation solutions in compliance with Nordea Quality Assurance standards. Your role involves strategic planning for continuous test improvements, test resource management, stakeholder management, and quality assurance uplift in the daily deliveries.  
 **What you’ll be doing:** 





* Plan and run QA and test management for both functional and non-functional testing, in concurrence with multiple and versatile scrum teams in a SAFe agile release train setup
* Secure test enablers such as us, test environments, and test data management
* Identify impediments, risks, and challenges corresponding to QA and test management and derive solutions to enable efficient QA and test progress
* Communicate regularly with key stakeholders in IT and business to report on QA risk status, testing progress, and improvement activities in a way that is transparent, accurate, and respectful of all perspectives
* Foster continuous learning and development of team members, supporting their growth as they contribute to the agile release trains and work to create a more equitable and inclusive workplace
* We prioritize daily tasks while also promoting the professional development and well-being of our employees. With us, you will have lots of opportunities to grow your skills and advance your career: take part in conferences, mentoring programs and interesting projects. If you enjoy working with international teams in an inspiring work environment, you'll value it here





  You’ll join a QA Capital Management Team. The role is based in Gdańsk, Stockholm or Warsaw.  
 



**Who you are** 






  
 





 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.   
 





  
 



**To succeed in this role, we strongly believe that the ideal candidate:**



* Are comfortable working with stakeholders at both strategic and hands-on levels. They should be able to build bridges between QA and stakeholders and create transparent communication channels between the business and the development team
* Have experience in working in Banking sector
* Have a continuous improvement focus when delivering results
* Have proven experience in implementing test automation approach into project





  
 **Your experience and background:** 





* Have experience managing functional- and non-functional testing, E2E-testing, test automation, test environment and test data management
* Have proven experience in QA Lead or Test Manager role for various size of teams in SAFe/Scrum environment for at least 5 years.
* Knowledge about testing automation frameworks to be able to recommend a proper solution
* Have worked with ETL, data warehouses and cloud solutions
* Have Knowledge of tools like Jira, Confluence, Helix, and Quality Management tools e.g qTest
* Possess excellent English language skills to effectively communicate with stakeholders of all backgrounds and identities



  
 



**Good to have:**



* Some interest in using AI in testing - GitHub Copilot



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps** 






  

  



 Submit your application no later than 30/11/2024
 



 . 
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





**For candidates in Sweden only -** 
  ​For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





**For candidates in Poland only -** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
 





  
 





 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf
 





  
 





 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: St1 Biokraft is looking for a Chief Financial Officer
description:
Are you a strategic and experienced finance leader ready to grow and scale with an innovative company? St1 Biokraft is on the lookout for a capable, business-oriented Chief Financial Officer to embark on an exciting journey with!
   

  

**A Powerful Partnership -** 
 St1 Biokraft is a joint venture between St1, HitecVision, and Aneo, bringing together expertise and resources to drive innovation in the biogas sector. At St1 Biokraft, we envision a future where biogas plays a pivotal role in the energy transition. Our mission is to become the leading integrated biogas player in the Nordics, fostering sustainable energy solutions that benefit both the environment and the economy.
   

  

 The company’s business activities cover the whole biogas value chain, from feedstock sourcing to distribution and end user sales. We are aiming for 3TWh biomethane production and 6TWh biomethane sales by 2030, targeting heavy transportation, maritime and industrial applications. St1 Biokraft is committed to investing over EUR 1 billion in biogas production and distribution networks, enhancing our current capacity of 550 GWh and combined sales of 1 TWh of biomethane. In addition, there are several biogas growth projects in the Nordics.
   

  

**We value ambition – and we have it! Do you?**
 As we are on our growth path, we are looking for a CFO who not only understands the logic of business but also comprehends the entire value chain. Read more and join us in shaping the future together!
   

  

 As the CFO
   

  

 you will play a pivotal role in shaping our financial strategy and driving our mission forward. If you are ready to make a significant impact in the renewable energy sector, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 Your role is comprehensive, we hope you can for example,
   

  

* Develop and implement financial strategies aligned with the company’s goals
* Oversee all financial operations, including budgeting, forecasting, and reporting
* Manage relationships with investors, banks, and other financial institutions
* Ensure compliance with financial regulations and standards
* Lead financial planning and analysis to support decision making
* Collaborate with other departments to drive operational efficiency and profitability


 You will play a crucial role in forecasting, allowing you to roll up your sleeves and help us prioritize and execute the right initiatives in the correct order. You will have the opportunity to build capabilities on our growth journey while guiding and supporting team performance. We are looking for someone eager to learn and passionate about driving substantial growth through our business, as we seek an individual who can grow alongside us and adapt to the evolving demands of the role.
   

  

 You will be a key player of focusing and evaluating our capability and work with the CEO Miika Johansson. You will also be a member of the St1 Biokraft leadership team. Location for this position is Stockholm.
   

  

 An ideal background that will help you to succeed in this position
   

  

* You have already gained solid experience in the financial field in relevant positions. You have insight in both, internal and external finance management.
* Your background includes working with growth companies, potentially from an international perspective.
* You possess understanding of value creation and risk-reward logic. We are looking for a strong candidate with a solid foundation in risk management.
* You maintain positive relationships, adopt a hands-on approach, and are comfortable navigating a certain level of ambiguity.
* You demonstrate strong interaction and communication skills in English.
* You excel at managing various aspects of growth from both financial and organizational perspectives, providing valuable support to the management and operational leadership. You have previous experience from the board.


**Most importantly, you have a business mindset.** 
 You possess both the desire and ability to understand our business logic and can effectively articulate this through financial data. You are grounded, your motivation comes from engaging work. You aspire to grow alongside the company and have a humble desire to learn and become well-versed in the business logic.
   

  

 Did we pique your interest? Awesome!
   

  

 Apply now, you get to leave your own handprint in the story of St1 Biokraft! The role is new and the framework for it will be adjusted according to the chosen CFO. We are open to hearing your salary request and your story, as well as your thoughts regarding the role, how does it align with your competencies, values and interests?
   

  

**Submit your application to our recruitment system** 
 . Please keep in mind that we might proceed already within the application period with potential candidates.
 **The last day to apply is 6.11.2024.**
 For data security reasons, we cannot receive applications by e-mail, so please submit your application through our recruitment system.
 **Please note that the location of this position is Stockholm.**
 For more information, please contact our recruitment partner from Greenstep: riika-maria.kuivalainen @ greenstep.fi.

title: Underrättelsehandläggare inom kontraspionage och icke-spridning
description:
Är du bra på att inhämta, bearbeta och analysera information? Vill du vara en viktig del av underrättelsearbetet på Säkerhetspolisen? Säkerhetspolisen söker nu erfarna, uthålliga och lösningsorienterade underrättelsehandläggare med olika bakgrund. Just nu söker vi särskilt dig med:
 



  




* Polisiär bakgrund med erfarenhet av operativt arbete, eller motsvarande erfarenhet från andra myndigheter
* Erfarenhet från andra nationella underrättelsemyndigheter



  





 Vi eftersträvar kompetensbredd bland våra medarbetare och ovanstående kompetenser utesluter inte dig med annan bakgrund. Välkommen med din ansökan.
 



  





 Vårt uppdrag är Sveriges säkerhet.
 



  





 Ort: Stockholm
 



 Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-30
 



  





**Så här arbetar vi på Säkerhetspolisen** 




 Säkerhetspolisens uppdrag är att skydda Sverige, det demokratiska systemet samt medborgarnas fri- och rättigheter. Det är vårt ansvar att det som inte får hända, inte heller händer.
 



  





 Dina kollegor är specialister, sakkunniga och samhällsintresserade. De vet att saker inte alltid är som de ser ut att vara vid första anblick. Därför söker vi personer som bidrar med kompletterande perspektiv, kunskaper och erfarenheter som sammantaget gör oss bättre.
 



  





 Det finns många olika yrken och kompetenser hos oss, och oavsett roll kommer du att samverka med och lära mycket av andra. Du kommer också att arbeta självständigt och utvecklas i din roll. Oavsett arbetsuppgift är du med och bidrar till Sveriges säkerhet.
 



  





 Som medarbetare på Säkerhetspolisen kan du förvänta dig ett ledarskap som bygger på helhetssyn, handlingskraft, goda relationer och lärande. Våra ledare coachar, stöttar och utmanar dig att ta ansvar för din och verksamhetens utveckling. Tillsammans bidrar vi alla till att skapa ett tryggt, öppet klimat med avsikt att förstå andras perspektiv och goda intentioner.
 



  





**Det här är ditt uppdrag** 




 En stor del av Säkerhetspolisens arbete handlar om olika former av underrättelseinhämtning. Underrättelsearbetet bedrivs genom inriktning, inhämtning, bearbetning, analys och delgivning av information. I rollen som underrättelsehandläggare är ditt arbete fokuserat på att handlägga och driva ärenden inom kontraspionage och icke-spridning. Du behandlar information i databaser, inriktar inhämtning av underrättelser och planerar och genomför operativa åtgärder i samverkan med andra myndigheter. Du kommunicerar och samverkar även med nationella och internationella samarbetspartners.
 



  





 Du är en viktig del i operativa ärenden, håller samtal med olika aktörer i samhället, utför operativa uppdrag och hanterar hemliga tvångsmedel. Att upprätta underrättelsesammanställningar som utgör underlag för beslut och åtgärder är också en viktig del av arbetet.
 



  





 Utöver det bidrar du aktivt till enhetens kontinuerliga metod- och verksamhetsutvecklingsarbete.
 



  





 Din placering är på huvudkontoret i Solna. Resor inom och utanför Sverige kan förekomma. Ibland kan arbetet även behövas utföras utanför kontorstid och det kan bli aktuellt med beredskap i olika utsträckning. Det är inte möjligt att utföra sina arbetsuppgifter hemifrån.
 



  





 Du som är polis och anställs i rollen som underrättelsehandläggare behåller dina polisiära befogenheter.
 



  





**De här kvalifikationerna söker vi hos dig** 




  




* Relevant akademisk utbildning, polisexamen eller annan utbildning eller erfarenhet som Säkerhetspolisen bedömer likvärdig
* Minst två års dokumenterad relevant arbetslivserfarenhet, exempelvis från myndighet
* Bred it-kunskap ur ett användarperspektiv
* Mycket god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift



  





 Du som söker kan också ha kompetens som tillför bredd och kompletterande perspektiv. Kan du bidra med något eller flera av följande är det meriterande:
 



  




* Erfarenhet av att bearbeta, berika och analysera information
* Erfarenhet av yttre polisiär verksamhet
* Erfarenhet av förundersöknings- och/eller underrättelsearbete
* Goda ämneskunskaper om kontraspionage
* Landkunskap om Kina, Ryssland eller Iran
* Språkkunskaper och/eller kulturell förståelse inom kinesiska, ryska, farsi eller arabiska
* Goda kunskaper om cyber, exempelvis aktörer och metoder för CNE
* Erfarenhet av att hantera stora mängder data från ostrukturerad till strukturerad form
* Erfarenhet inom företagsekonomi och/eller företagsjuridik
* Goda kunskaper om forskning inom framväxande teknikområden



  





**Det här är kollegan vi söker** 




 Vi fäster stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som är lösningsinriktad med god analytisk förmåga. Du har hög personlig mognad och ett prestigelöst förhållningssätt och som med engagemang och ansvarstagande tar dig an ditt arbete. Att se till verksamhetens gemensamma mål före individuella prestationer är en självklarhet för dig.
 



  





 Du har lätt för att skapa och upprätthålla förtroendefulla kontakter och bidrar aktivt till ett gott arbetsklimat och en kultur som skapar motivation, delaktighet och engagemang. Du trivs bra med att arbeta både självständigt och tillsammans med andra och du har god förmåga att samarbeta med olika yrkeskategorier. Med din goda presentationsförmåga kan du på ett tydligt och förtroendeingivande sätt delge information till olika målgrupper och i olika sammanhang.
 



  





 Som person är du noggrann och uthållig med god förmåga att strukturera och prioritera ditt arbete, även under perioder med hög arbetsbelastning. Arbetsuppgifter och arbetsområden har både kortsiktigt och långsiktigt fokus och kan ibland förändras med kort varsel. Det är därför viktigt att du är flexibel, kan växla i tempo och ställa om mellan planerad och händelsestyrd verksamhet när situationen kräver det.
 



  





 Säkerhetspolisen ställer höga krav på säkerhet- och sekretess, därför förutsätter vi att du har ett högt säkerhetsmedvetande.
 



  





**Anställningsvillkor** 




 Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav, då anställning vid Säkerhetspolisen innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. För anställning krävs också godkänt resultat i säkerhetsprövningen med registerkontroll, som genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
 



  





 Det här är en tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
 



  





 På vår hemsida, www.sakerhetspolisen.se, kan du läsa mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss samt om våra förmåner.
 



  





**Så tar du kontakt med oss** 




 Du är välkommen att ringa rekryterande chef, tfn 010-568 77 42 eller 010-568 75 92. För information om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta HR-enheten, tfn 010-568 70 06.
 



  





 Fackliga företrädare: Polisförbundet, tfn 010-568 70 03, SACO, tfn 010-568 70 04 och ST, tfn 010-568 70 02.
 



  





**Så ansöker du** 




 Ansökan sker via vår hemsida, www.sakerhetspolisen.se
 



  





 Ansökan ska ha kommit in senast
 **2024-10-30.** 




  





 I ditt personliga brev och CV vill vi att du beskriver på vilket sätt du uppfyller våra efterfrågade krav och eventuella meriter. Beskriv också hur dina personliga egenskaper bidrar i rollen.
 



  





**Preliminär anställningsstart september 2025** 




  





**Övrig information** 




 Du bör inte berätta att du sökt tjänst hos Säkerhetspolisen för andra personer än dina närmast berörda. Det beror på att vi har tjänster som omfattas av sekretess.
 



  





 I våra rekryteringar använder vi arbetspsykologiska tester.
 



  





 Vi har redan gjort våra val av annonskanaler. Vi undanber oss därför samtal från rekryteringsföretag och annonsförsäljare.

title: Building Services Leader - Nordic and Baltic Zone
description:
Are you ready to take charge and drive success in Digital Energy within the Nordic Baltic Zone? We are searching for a passionate leader to inspire and guide our team, turning our vision into a shared mission. If you're excited about taking on this challenge and making a significant impact within Schneider Electric, we want to hear from you! Join us in shaping the future of energy management and automation.
   

  

**What we offer you:**
 As a key member of our Nordic management team, reporting to the VP Digital Energy Nordic Baltic Zone, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the strategic direction of the services business in the region. Your focus will be on driving performance, providing support to countries, and leading future business development.
   

  

* Develop and implement the regional services strategy, concentrating on performance and future business development in alignment with company goals.
* Oversee the P&L of the services organization in the Nordic Baltic zone, emphasizing country support and operational excellence
* Prioritize customer satisfaction and loyalty through exceptional service delivery, strong customer connections, and initiatives that enhance customer retention.
* Drive operational efficiency by streamlining processes and resources, supporting countries to deliver services efficiently while maintaining high quality.
* Lead the development of a high-performing team of service professionals, setting performance objectives and nurturing a culture of high performance.


**What we are looking for:**
* Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, or a relevant field.
* Experience in leadership within the services industry, focusing on aligning service strategies with company goals and driving operational excellence.
* Proven track record of effectively managing P&L, achieving financial goals, and fostering a culture of high performance within teams.
* Fluent in English; knowledge of any Nordic language is advantageous.


 We are seeking a candidate with strong business acumen, financial expertise, and strategic insight to drive performance, support countries, and shape future business development. If you possess outstanding interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills, along with analytical and problem-solving abilities, we'd like to hear from you.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?**
 Please submit your application soonest. We will fulfill the position as soon as the suitable candidate has been found. Read more about our Digital Energy Business:
   

  

 https://www.se.com/ww/en/work/campaign/buildings-of-the-future/
   

  

**Why us?**
 At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a
 **meaningful** 
 purpose in joining our mission to bring energy and efficiency to enable life, progress and sustainability for all.
   

  

 We believe in
 **e** 
**mpowering** 
 our team members to reach their full potential, fostering a sense of ownership in their work.
   

  

 We embrace
 **inclusion** 
 as a fundamental value, ensuring that every voice is heard and valued. We value differences, and welcome people from all walks of life. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.
   

  

 If you want to be part of a company where your contributions truly matter, where you are empowered to make a difference and where inclusivity is valued, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Discover your
 **M** 
**eaningful, Inclusive** 
 and
 **Empowered** 
 career at Schneider Electric.
   

  

 €34.2bn global revenue
   

  

 +12% organic growth
   

  

 135 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 #1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
   

  

*Schneider Electric aspires* 
*to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best.*
*We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate and we ‘embrace different’ as one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.*

*, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.*

title: Business Controller
description:
*Spännande möjlighet som Affärscontroller på Länsförsäkringar Fondliv! Vi söker en driven och nyfiken controller med erfarenhet inom business controlling. Ta chansen att vara en del av vårt team och bidra till vår framgång som ett ledande pensionsbolag.*
**Om jobbet**
 Fondliv är under stor förflyttning mot införande av agila arbetssätt, transformering av IT-system och förändring av affärsmodeller för att nå målet om att i framtiden vara ett ledande pensionsbolag. Affärsenhet Fondliv söker nu en civilekonom som vill jobba i en verksamhet under förändring och som drivs av att utmana befintliga strukturer och att aktivt jobba med och mot affärsverksamheten. Rollen som Affärscontroller är en tillsvidareanställning och du kommer att arbeta nära affären i samarbete med övriga affärscontrollers och ingå i gruppen Fondliv Business Control.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter i denna roll är följande:
   

  

* Stödja avdelningen Produkt & Erbjudande samt utveckla bolagets styrning och uppföljning.
* Samarbeta nära affären i samarbete med övriga affärscontrollers.
* Delta i Fondlivs transformation och agila förflyttning.
* Stödja avdelningen i affärs- och finansiella frågor.
* Utveckla och förbättra bolagets affärsplanering, prognoser och rapportering, Vara stöd i nyttjande av BI-verktyg, excellösningar eller liknande.
* Hantera analysunderlag och rapporter med uppdrag att utveckla, effektivisera och automatisera processer och rapporter.
* Vara Fondlivs huvudkontakt/beställare för prognos- och uppföljningssystem samt ekonomiadministrativa system och processer som sköts av moderbolaget Länsförsäkringar AB.


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik för denna tjänst:
   

  

* Ekonomiutbildning på högskolenivå.
* Flera års erfarenhet som businesscontroller eller likvärdig erfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet av sparförsäkring, särskilt fondförsäkring är meriterande.
* Goda allmänna kunskaper inom ekonomi.


 Som person är du engagerad och har en stark drivkraft att utmana, förbättra och utveckla för helhetens bästa med kunden, affärs- och verksamhetsbehovet i fokus. Du är flexibel och beredd att självständigt arbeta med en bred palett av utmaningar, både enkla och komplexa arbetsuppgifter, och framför allt trivs du med att samverka med andra. Du är självklart även nyfiken på, eller redan väl insatt i, lean agila arbetssättet. För att känna dig trygg i din roll och utveckling behöver du självledarskap, ha mod och integritet men också våga ta hjälp av andra på vägen! Att leva inom Länsförsäkringar AB:s kulturkod är en självklarhet.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Fondliv Business Control / Controllergruppen består av 4 personer och utgör tillsammans med Aktuarie gruppen avdelningen Finance & Governance som leds av CFO. Totalt består avdelningen av 12 personer. Controllergruppen har ett brett ansvar inom finansiell styrning och rapportering samt är involverade i införandet av lean agilt arbetssätt och styrning. Vi är även knytpunkt för samverkan med övriga Länsförsäkringar AB och Länsbolagen avseende finansiella frågor och processer.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-11-07**

title: Senior Accountant
description:
**Connect with Quadient**
 At Quadient, we support businesses of all sizes in their digital transformation and growth journey, unlocking operational efficiency with reliable, secure, and sustainable automation processes. Our success in delivering innovation and business growth is inspired by the connections our diverse teams create every day, with our clients and each other. It’s these connections that make Quadient such an exceptional place to grow your career, develop your skills and make a real impact – help our future-focused business lead the way in powering secure and sustainable business connections through digital and physical channels.
   

  

 Are you an experienced accountant who values autonomy and trust, and wants to work for a global company that retains a local feel in the Nordics region
   

  

**Your role in our future**
 You will report directly to the Nordic Accounting Manager based in Stockholm, and your role involves the following tasks:
   

* You will be managing daily general ledger entries and you will be responsible for accounts receivable and accounts payable, performing daily bank account reconciliations, and preparing and booking monthly accruals and provisions.
* You will conduct monthly and yearly balance sheet reconciliations. Performing monthly intercompany reconciliations, and preparing salaries and expenses.
* Acting as the main contact for authorities, you will be managing tax accounting, VAT declarations, and annual tax returns, and reporting to authorities.
* You will be preparing monthly and annual financial reports in compliance with both local GAAP and IFRS standards, and coordinating with external auditors during year-end closing and preparing annual reports.
* You will participate in finance-related process improvement projects, working closely with, and supporting the Nordic Finance Team.


**Your profile**
* You hold a degree in Economics or Finance (accounting/controlling) and have several years of experience in a similar role, or equivalent.
* You have demonstrated expertise in financial accounting and are advanced in Microsoft Excel.
* You are solution-oriented, meticulous, and have a structured approach to work. You are autonomous and proactive.
* You thrive in a fast-paced international environment with diverse cultural backgrounds. You are able to deliver high quality results within strict deadlines.
* You are fluent in both written and spoken Swedish and English. Fluency in other Nordic languages and prior experience working with Nordic companies are highly advantageous.


 Knowledge gaps can be filled. Even if you don’t satisfy every single requirement or meet every qualification listed, we still want to hear from you.
   

  

 Help shape the future of customer communications. Apply now.
   

  

**Rewards & Benefits**
**Flexible Work** 
 : Embrace a hybrid work model blending office and remote setup for a balanced lifestyle.
   

  

**Endless Learning:** 
 Access global opportunities for growth through our 24/7 online learning platform.
   

  

**Inclusive Community:** 
 Join diverse communities and engage in our Philanthropy program.
   

  

**Comprehensive Rewards:** 
 Enjoy competitive Total Rewards covering wellness, work/life balance, and more, including a generous referral scheme.
   

  

**Caring for Wellbeing** 
 : Access our complimentary employee assistance program for mental health support.
   

  

 Be yourself at Quadient
   

  

 Our values define how we work as a team: Empowerment, Passion, Inspiration and Community. They inspire us to be EPIC. Together. What makes Quadient different is how different we are. We’re a team of individuals with one goal but many perspectives. When you connect with Quadient, you become part of a community that cares - in a culture that embraces differences and values every voice.
   

  

 We will consider any reasonable modifications to the interview process. If you require any assistance with the application process, please email us at careers@quadient.com
   

  

 Quadient is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*: We believe that diversity brings benefits to our customers, our business, and our people so we are committed to being an inclusive employer. We encourage applications from all suitable applicants, regardless of background. We firmly believe in zero discrimination in employment on any basis, including gender, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, national origin, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other protected characteristics.
   

* This includes being an Affirmative Action Employer in the United States.


**People. Connected.**

title: Underrättelsehandläggare inom kontraterror  och författningsskydd
description:
Händelser i omvärlden påverkar vår vardag och det är inte alltid våra dagar ser ut som vi har tänkt. Säkerhetspolisen söker nu dig som vill handlägga och driva underrättelseärenden som en del i att bedöma och reducera hotaktörers avsikt och förmåga att bedriva säkerhetshotande verksamhet. Sök ett jobb där du är med och gör skillnad.
 



  





 Tillsammans skyddar vi Sverige.
 



  





 Ort: Stockholm
 



 Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-30
 



  





**Så här arbetar vi på Säkerhetspolisen** 




 Säkerhetspolisens uppdrag är att skydda Sverige, det demokratiska systemet samt medborgarnas fri- och rättigheter. Det är vårt ansvar att det som inte får hända, inte heller händer.
 



  





 Dina kollegor är specialister, sakkunniga och samhällsintresserade. De vet att saker inte alltid är som de ser ut att vara vid första anblick. Därför söker vi personer som bidrar med kompletterande perspektiv, kunskaper och erfarenheter som sammantaget gör oss bättre.
 



  





 Det finns många olika yrken och kompetenser hos oss, och oavsett roll kommer du att samverka med och lära mycket av andra. Du kommer också att arbeta självständigt och utvecklas i din roll. Oavsett arbetsuppgift är du med och bidrar till Sveriges säkerhet.
 



  





  





 Som medarbetare på Säkerhetspolisen kan du förvänta dig ett ledarskap som bygger på helhetssyn, handlingskraft, goda relationer och lärande. Våra ledare coachar, stöttar och utmanar dig att ta ansvar för din och verksamhetens utveckling. Tillsammans bidrar vi alla till att skapa ett tryggt, öppet klimat med avsikt att förstå andras perspektiv och goda intentioner.
 



  





**Det här är ditt uppdrag** 




 Säkerhetspolisens uppdrag är komplext, som kollegor kompletterar vi varandra och till den här tjänsten söker vi både dig med polisiär och dig med civil bakgrund. Att förhindra brott mot Sveriges säkerhet handlar om att ligga steget före, både i det kortsiktiga arbetet med att upptäcka och avvärja hot här och nu, och i det långsiktiga arbetet med att till exempel bryta tillväxten i de våldsbejakande extremistmiljöerna. Säkerhetspolisen arbetar aktivt med att bedöma och reducera hotaktörers avsikt och förmåga att bedriva säkerhetshotande verksamhet.
 



  





 I rollen som underrättelsehandläggare är ditt arbete fokuserat på att handlägga och driva operativa ärenden och operationer inom ramen för kontraterrorism och författningsskydd. Du behandlar operativ information i databaser, inriktar inhämtning av underrättelser och planerar och genomför operativa hotreducerande åtgärder i samverkan med andra myndigheter. Du kommunicerar och samarbetar även med nationella och internationella samarbetspartners.
 



 Du är en viktig del i operativa ärenden, håller samtal med aktörer och hanterar hemliga tvångsmedel. Att upprätta underrättelsesammanställningar som utgör underlag för beslut och operativa åtgärder är också en viktig del av arbetet. Som en i teamet är du även med och bidrar till enhetens fortlöpande metod- och utvecklingsarbete.
 



  





 Din placering är på huvudkontoret i Solna och arbetet utförs på plats utan möjlighet till distansarbete. Du kan ibland behöva arbeta utanför vanliga kontorstider, det vill säga på kvällar och helger. Resor inom och utanför Sverige förekommer.
 



  





 Du som är polis och anställs i rollen som underrättelsehandläggare behåller dina polisiära befogenheter.
 



  





**De här kvalifikationerna söker vi hos dig** 




  




* Relevant akademisk utbildning, polisexamen eller annan utbildning eller erfarenhet som Säkerhetspolisen bedömer likvärdig
* Minst två års dokumenterad relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* God förmåga att bearbeta och analysera information
* Allmän god IT-kunskap
* God förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift



  





 Du som söker kan också ha kompetens som tillför bredd och kompletterande perspektiv. Kan du bidra med något eller flera av följande är det meriterande:
 



  




* B-körkort
* Erfarenhet av annan polisiär verksamhet
* Erfarenhet från något av Säkerhetspolisens verksamhetsområden
* Erfarenhet av utrednings- eller underrättelsearbete
* Erfarenhet av brottsbekämpande eller rättsvårdande verksamhet
* Erfarenhet av att använda olika it-system på ett rättssäkert sätt
* Språkkunskap och/eller kulturell förståelse, inom främst arabiska
* Erfarenhet av att hantera stora mängder data från ostrukturerad till strukturerad form
* Goda kunskaper inom utlänningslagstiftningen och erfarenhet av att arbeta med migrationsärenden



  





**Det här är kollegan vi söker** 




 För att trivas i denna roll behöver du tycka om att vara i händelsernas centrum. Det krävs att du har förmågan att hantera frågor av operativ karaktär som kan behöva dömas av med kort varsel, samtidigt som du driver operativa frågor som är långsiktiga, ofta i samverkan med andra enheter och parter.
 



  





 Händelser i omvärlden påverkar vår vardag och det är inte alltid våra dagar ser ut som vi tänkt. Det kräver att du är en problemlösare med god analytisk förmåga som kan prioritera och snabbt ställa om mellan planerad och händelsestyrd verksamhet när det behövs. Det är viktigt att du är uthållig och kan behålla fokus, även när trycket stundtals är högt.
 



  





 Som person är du noggrann och ansvarsfull med en prestigelös inställning. Du bidrar aktivt till ett gott arbetsklimat som skapar motivation, delaktighet och engagemang. Samarbete passar dig bra och du trivs med att arbeta i team samtidigt som du självständigt driver ditt arbete framåt.
 



 Du har ett lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt och trivs med att arbeta i, och bidra till, en verksamhet i ständig utveckling. Du har ett helhetsperspektiv och drivs av verksamhetens gemensamma framgångar snarare än av individuella prestationer.
 



  





 Du är förtroendeingivande och du har lätt för att skapa tillitsfulla kontakter och upprätthålla goda relationer. Du lyssnar in och har ett gott samarbete med olika yrkeskategorier.
 



  





 Säkerhetspolisen ställer höga krav på säkerhet och sekretess, därför förutsätter vi att du har ett högt säkerhetsmedvetande.
 



  





**Anställningsvillkor** 




 Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav, då anställning vid Säkerhetspolisen innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. För anställning krävs också godkänt resultat i säkerhetsprövningen med registerkontroll, som genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
 



  





 Det här är en tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
 



  





 På vår hemsida, www.sakerhetspolisen.se, kan du läsa mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss samt om våra förmåner.
 








  





**Så tar du kontakt med oss** 




 Du är välkommen att ringa rekryterande chef, tfn 010-568 71 11 eller 010-568 77 34. För information om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta HR-enheten, tfn 010-568 70 06.
 



  





 Fackliga företrädare: Polisförbundet, tfn 010-568 70 03, SACO, tfn 010-568 70 04 och ST, tfn 010-568 70 02.
 



  





**Så ansöker du** 




 Ansökan sker via vår hemsida, www.sakerhetspolisen.se
 



 Ansökan ska ha kommit in
 **senast 2024-10-30.** 




  





 I ditt personliga brev och CV vill vi att du beskriver på vilket sätt du uppfyller våra efterfrågade krav och eventuella meriter. Beskriv också hur dina personliga egenskaper bidrar i rollen.
 



  





**Preliminär anställningsstart september 2025.** 




  





**Övrig information** 




 Du bör inte berätta att du sökt tjänst hos Säkerhetspolisen för andra personer än dina närmast berörda. Det beror på att vi har tjänster som omfattas av sekretess.
 



  





 I våra rekryteringar använder vi arbetspsykologiska tester.
 



  





 Vi har redan gjort våra val av annonskanaler. Vi undanber oss därför samtal från rekryteringsföretag och annonsförsäljare.

title: Oracle NetSuite Regional Director - Sales Development
description:
**Job Description**
**Why Oracle** 
**NetSuite**
 Founded in 1998, Oracle NetSuite was the first cloud company – ushering in the new era of cloud computing. NetSuite’s mission is to deliver one system, the suite, that gives leaders a complete view into their business.
   

  

 As the industry leading cloud business system recognised in Gartner’s Magic Quadrants, NetSuite includes financials, inventory management, HR, professional services automation, commerce, and more. Tens of thousands of customers all over the world trust NetSuite to give their businesses the visibility, agility, and control needed to make data-informed decisions quickly.
   

  

 NetSuite is a place where you can build a career and have fun while doing so! We’re invested in our people, our customers, and the community. And as part of Oracle, our benefits are second to none. Joining our passionate team means that you’re ready to take your career to the next level. With priceless learning opportunities, strong support, incredible innovation, and volunteer opportunities, NetSuite is committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels empowered and set up for success.
   

  

  

  

**The Oracle NetSuite Sales Development Organisation**
 The Sales Development Organisation provides Sales Development Representatives with a hands-on experience qualifying leads while building product knowledge and developing fundamental sales skills. Within this role, SDRs get the best of both worlds – training and autonomy. The SDR role provides an unmissable, hands-on learning opportunity that will allow them to contribute to our ongoing success.
   

  

 We are looking to hire our next superstar Regional Director to help us continue to accelerate our YoY growth through revenue generation. This Regional Director will coach and develop their management and SDRs, support the sales leadership in the region to meet targets, and work with recruiting to hit annual hiring goals.
   

  

 As such this senior position requires a strong, hands-on leader who has experience in inside sales or SDR programs and strong analytical skills.
 **Extensive management experience is essential.** 
 They will also have significant experience engaging with sales leaders over their sales execution strategy and how their SDRs can accelerate achievement of this.
   

  

**Want to know more? Check out these resources.**
* NetSuite Instagram
* NetSuite Website
* NetSuite Customer Testimonials
* NetSuite LinkedIn Page
* NetSuite YouTube Channel


 Career Level - M3
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Your Responsibilities**
* Setting expectations with senior sales management through timely and accurate forecasting, pipeline and sales activity/program metrics reporting
* Motivating individuals to succeed through impassioned leadership, coaching, creative sales incentives, and broadcast of results
* Developing plans to foster a competitive and collaborative team environment
* Driving program and participant success; investing in the success of the team and going above and beyond to mentor a team of individuals
* Owning the recruiting process for future SDRs and management
* Refining and critiquing processes and ensuring adherence within the team and with stakeholders
* Creating and developing programs and campaigns in conjunction with Sales - should be able to execute programs and campaigns with limited guidance
* Managing day-to-day activities of the team
* Serving as an active coach through feedback sessions
* Preparing SDRs for regular reviews with the NetSuite senior management team
* Acquiring and maintaining a working knowledge of the complete capabilities of NetSuite's service offerings
* Collaborating with peers globally


**Minimum Qualifications**
* Native level of Swedish + fluency in English (additional languages advantageous)
* Strong background in sales development, inside sales and/or sales management required, second-line management experience an advantage
* Intelligent, motivated and competitive with a “roll-up-the-sleeves” and “get the job done” attitude
* Excellent communication (verbal, written, and presentation) and interpersonal skills (outgoing and personable)
* Experience engaging with sales over revenue strategy and creating alignment and campaigns to accelerate their achievement of goals
* Inspires a team focused, collaborative and positive environment
* Passion for coaching and mentoring emerging sales talent
* Experience giving both positive and constructive feedback
* Completely invested in driving both individual contributor and team success
* Desire to work in tech industry with a growing company
* Excellent organisational, prioritisation, and time management skills
* Focused on driving a team to collective lead generation quotas/goals
* Ability to create and track individual and team metrics
* Creative self-starter
* University degree required


**Life at Oracle and Equal Opportunity:**
 An Oracle career can span industries, roles, countries, and cultures, giving you the opportunity to flourish in new roles and innovate, while blending work life in. Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry.
   

  

 In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation.
   

  

 Oracle offers a highly competitive suite of Employee Benefits designed on the principles of parity, consistency, and affordability. The overall package includes certain core elements such as Medical, Life Insurance, access to Retirement Planning, and much more. We also encourage our employees to engage in the culture of giving back to the communities where we live and do business.
   

  

 At Oracle, we believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to successfully participate in the job application, interview process, and in potential roles to perform crucial job functions. That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.
   

  

 Disclaimer: Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

 https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/diversity-inclusion/
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.
   

  

**Disclaimer:**
 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

title: Research Fellow (Childlight UNSW Hub)
description:
This Job is based in Australia
   

  

* Employment Type: 3-Year Fixed-Term Contract, Full-Time (35 hours p/week)
* Remuneration: $123,620 - $145,730 + 17% super + leave loading (commensurate with experience)
* Location: Randwick (Hybrid Working Opportunities)


**About UNSW**
 UNSW isn’t like other places you’ve worked. Yes, we’re a large organisation with a diverse and talented community, a community doing extraordinary things. Together, we are driven to be thoughtful, practical, and purposeful in all we do. Taking this combined approach is what makes our work matter. If you want a career where you can thrive, be challenged and do meaningful work, you’re in the right place.
   

  

**Why Your Role Matters**
 As the Research Fellow you will work in the Childlight UNSW Hub, based in the School of Social Sciences, and primarily be responsible for engaging potential research partners and sourcing potential research collaborations in the Asia-Pacific region as well as culturally appropriate knowledge exchange.
   

  

 The Hub has been established to conduct research on child sexual abuse and exploitation, with a focus on technology-facilitated abuse and the needs and rights of victims and survivors. Childlight UNSW is the South-East Asian Hub of Childlight, the Global Data Institute for Child Safety at the University of Edinburgh and conducts research in the Australasian region as part of Childlight’s global strategy to turn data and research into impact to better safeguard children against child sexual abuse and exploitation. While research focused academics at this Level are expected to primarily focus on research, this position will also make a limited contribution to education and engagement activities within the School of Social Sciences and/or Faculty.
   

  

 The role will be split across research (80%) and Education and Engagement (20%).
   

  

 The Research Fellow reports to the HOS of Social Sciences with an indirect reporting line to the Director of the Childlight UNSW Hub and has no direct reports.
   

  

**Responsibilities Summary**
* Participate in innovative and original qualitative research, nationally and internationally on child sexual abuse and exploitation consistent with the strategic work of the Childlight UNSW Hub.
* Contribute to research projects that have a significant impact to the strategic work of the Hub and with a focus on the Asia-Pacific region
* Design an external Engagement Strategy to initiate and strengthen collaborations in the Asia-Pacific region for the Childlight UNSW Hub in consultation with the Childlight Director.
* Resource knowledge exchange activities that are appropriate to the work of the Hub within UNSW and
* across South-East Asian collaborations.
* Contribute to education activities including the development of curriculum, teaching modules and short courses that also contribute to knowledge exchange. This may also include supervision of undergraduate and postgraduate placements and internships.
* Mentor and guide students, groups, and colleagues; supervise Honours and HDR students to timely completion as a joint or secondary supervisor.


*For more information regarding the responsibilities for this role, please refer to the Position Description at JOBS@UNSW.*
**Skills And Experience Summary**
* A PhD in a related discipline, and/or relevant work experience.
* Proven commitment to proactively keeping up to date with discipline knowledge and developments.
* Demonstrated track record in developing research collaborations and related opportunities, preferably in the Asia-Pacific region research with outcomes of high quality and high impact.
* Demonstrated ability to work in a team, collaborate across disciplines and build effective relationships.
* Evidence of highly developed interpersonal and organisational skills.


**Benefits and Culture:** 
 People are at the core of everything we do. We recognise it is the contributions of our staff who make UNSW one of the best universities in Australia and the world. Our benefits include:
   

  

* Career development opportunities
* 17% Superannuation contributions and additional leave loading payments
* Additional 3 days of leave over Christmas period
* Discounts and entitlements (retail, education, fitness)


**How to Apply:** 
 Make each day matter with a meaningful career at UNSW. Submit your CV along with a cover letter that outlines your interest and suitability for the position in relation to the ‘skills and experience’ section above, via the application portal before
 **20th** 
 of
 **November** 
 at
 **11:30pm.**
 A copy of the Position Description can be found on JOBS@UNSW.
   

  

**Get in Touch:** 
 For queries regarding the recruitment process, contact Lucy Gerondis, Talent Acquisition Consultant, UNSW: l.gerondis@unsw.edu.au
   

  

 Applications sent via email will not be accepted, please apply via the application portal.
   

  

*UNSW is committed to evolving a culture that embraces equity and supports a diverse and inclusive community where everyone can participate fairly, in a safe and respectful environment. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and encourage applications from people of diverse gender, sexual orientation, cultural and linguistic backgrounds, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background, people with disability and those with caring and family responsibilities. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff.*
*The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.*

title: Data Engineer (Consultant)
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Come work with us** 




 Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.
 



  





**About us** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.
 



  





**What does it mean to be a Data Engineer Consultant at Netlight?** 




 It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar with your experience, and from there it is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like. As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems, and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.
 



  





 As a Data Engineer Consultant, you will help our clients in projects with roles in Data Engineering. It can be working within Data Engineering, Data Architecture, or project management in terms of working with data or utilizing data to make product decisions to mention a few examples.
 



  





**Minimum Qualifications** 



* Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
* Verbal and written fluency in English
* 0,5-5 years of work experience within the data engineering field related to IT and software products in agile teams



  





**Application** 




 We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications. We will get in touch within two weeks if we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.

title: Alleima Rotation Program
description:
*At Alleima our mission is much more than delivering high-quality products, technology, and processes - working together to develop solutions based on our customers' needs and thus achieving our business goals, is a better way to describe our daily work. With curious employees and safety as our priority, we create a work environment where you can develop both personally and professionally.*
*We are a world-leading advanced materials company that produces high value-added products in advanced stainless steels and special alloys as well as products for industrial heating .*
*With a clear direction for our journey ahead, utilizing our position as a technology leader, progressive customer partner, and sustainability driver, we aim to become an even stronger company in our industry.*
*We have two passions. Material perfection…* 
*And people!*
*Are you ready to take on this challenge together with us? Join us on our journey!*
**Your Role**
 As a participant in our Global Rotation Program within Alleima group, including our Kanthal Business, you work with different predefined Key initiatives for example in areas of operational and commercial excellence, continuous improvements, quality, value stream mapping, market analytics and automation projects to mention some of them.
   

  

 These initiatives will be carried out in countries like US, Germany, India, Czech Republic, UK, and Sweden, making a significant impact on our business and our customers.
   

  

 With a master’s degree in engineering in relevant areas such as mechanical, material science or industrial engineering, or a master’s degree in finance or business control, you will be integrated into our Business Units and Operation Sites to develop and contribute to our activities.
   

  

 You will take significant ownership for the projects you participate in and drive improvement initiatives and performance management. You will work on four-month rotations in three different Business Units around the globe, engaging in interesting and relevant projects.
   

  

 All accommodations during the rotations abroad will be arranged by the company.
   

  

 The program is scheduled to start during March 2025 and will continue through March 2026.
   

  

 It is designed to lead to a permanent position within one of our Business Units somewhere in the world.
   

  

**We will offer you**
 We offer full time, permanent employment in the program from day one as a Project manager within the program. During the first assignment, participants will meet in Sandviken Sweden for a week of introduction and training, focused on getting to know our business and on your development. Upon hire, you will be assigned a company mentor who will provide you with guidance and advice to build your career plan.
   

  

 At the end of the program, you will perform an evaluation with your mentor and the Global Program Leads. All training both in hard and soft skills during the program are meant to build the foundation of your future career evolution.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We are seeking candidates with one of the following qualifications:
   

  

* A master’s degree in engineering (e.g., mechanical, material science or industrial engineering)
* A master’s degree in finance or business control


 Experience in collaboration on different projects is essential for both areas.
   

  

 Is your background within engineering we expect you to understand manufacturing and business processes, have analytical skills of machine, process and product data and be able to transform that knowledge into actions. Experience with LEAN manufacturing concepts and continuous improvements is also required.
   

  

 If your background is in finance or business control, you should have a strong ability to analyze financial data, prepare forecasts and deliver meaningful reports to drive business decisions.
   

  

 You have a good experience and understanding of financial mechanisms in a manufacturing environment, as well as a solid understanding of market trends and connect financial data to broader business strategies.
   

  

 We place great value on your personal qualities, including a powerful performance focus and initiative-taking abilities. You are intellectually curious, open to challenges and comfortable in highly changing environments. To be successful in the role, you demonstrate a high level of emotional intelligence and multicultural maturity. You are enthusiastic about our industry , mobile and open to living and working in various parts of the world. As this position has an international exposure, you need to have effective communication skills in English, both verbally and written, making it easy for you to build relationships and cooperate with people from all over the world.
   

  

 As an individual you excel at engaging with people at all levels and are open to challenges and comfortable in highly changing environments. We work intensively with the various apps in the Office platform, and we expect you to be a frequent user who keeps up to date with the latest features to work smarter, not harder. You are also skilled at simplifying complex concepts. We highly value your broad experience, strong integrity, and ability to get things done.
   

  

 We understand that not every candidate will meet every requirement listed in the profile description. If you are passionate about this role and believe you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to apply even if you don't check every box. We value potential, creativity, and a willingness to learn.
   

  

 Locations for these multiple positions are flexible.
   

  

**What you can expect from us** 
  

  

 At Alleima we are convinced that diversity and inclusion lead to a better workplace for our employees, our company, and our customers.
   

  

**We care:** 
 We take pride in what we do. We care about our customers, our people, the environment, the communities in which we operate and the future we share.
   

  

**We deliver:** 
 We deliver on our commitments, with a solution-oriented mindset, we enable our customers to be their very best: more efficient, profitable and sustainable.
   

  

**We evolve:** 
 We constantly evolve. Together we take the lead to advance materials, ambitions, industries, ourselves – and societies for the better.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated) no later than 2024-11-17.
   

  

 Are you ready to take on this challenge together with us? Join us on our journey! www.alleima.com.
   

  

**Recruitment process timeline**
 Selection period, 18th –22nd of November- 2024
   

  

 First round of interviews, 27th of November–5th of December 2024
   

  

 Second round of interviews and offer to final candidates,
   

  

 9th of December- 13th of December 2024
   

  

 Are you interested in learning more about these exciting positions?
   

  

**Please contact**
 Veronica Magnusson, VP & Head of Alleima Competence Center
   

  

 +46 (0)70 616 52 48 or veronica.magnusson@alleima.com
   

  

 Learn more about us, We are Alleima
   

  

 Prior to this recruitment, we have already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to utilize. Considering this, we respectfully decline any additional contact with marketing or recruitment agencies.

title: Cisco Collaboration Engineer
description:
**Position Summary**
 The Cisco Collaboration Engineer’s role within IT Service Delivery is to plan, design, build, install, configure, manage, secure, document, and support the systems within Data Center, Distribution Center, Public and Private Cloud environments, providing resilient, and scalable IT Services to support a fast-growing company.
   

  

 This role will be focused on the Cisco voice infrastructure, and will be responsible for developing, implementing, and documenting best practices and standards aimed at optimizing the VOIP infrastructure. The Collaboration Engineer will provide technical expertise, with ability to work on multiple projects and issues simultaneously, focusing on operational excellence and continuous improvement activities for Global IT Operations through ITIL based IT Service Management processes and procedures.
   

  

 The successful candidate must have excellent customer service, written, and verbal communication skills, and must be able to work collaboratively across multiple departments, business partners, and suppliers to meet operational performance and reliability targets. This role is critical in ensuring we collectively achieve our IT collaboration strategy: Enabling business & employee success through IT services that anticipate demand and simply work, anywhere, anytime.
   

  

**Position Responsibilities May Include, But Not Limited To**
* Provide end to end ownership and accountability for the service delivery, maintenance, and support of the global VOIP infrastructure of Client, and performance of the managed service provider(s).
* Managing telephony migrations from on-premise CUCM into Cisco Cloud (Webex Calling).
* Design, build, manage, optimize, support, and maintain the Client Holdings global enterprise VOIP environment including, but not limited to: CUCM, SIP CUBE, Webex Calling and Contact Center.
* Based on industry-best standards, develop and maintain technical standards and system configuration documentation, physical and logical diagrams, knowledge base articles, and runbooks for the proper transition of services to external managed service providers.
* Responsible for software and hardware upgrades relating to the Cisco voice infrastructure, including EOL/EOS refresh as part of life cycle management, ongoing security patching and vulnerability remediation according to established standards.
* Proactively and reactively identify and remediate voice and video performance issues and act as escalation point to review and resolve technical issues through completion, including root cause analysis and corrective actions.
* Provide Tier 3 technical expertise and support relating to Cisco voice infrastructure, and act as escalation point for the IT Service Center to review and resolve technical issues through completion, including root cause analysis and corrective actions.
* Participate in an on-call rotation to provide operational support as needed, which may include off hours.
* Adhere to and participate in the current and future IT Service Management processes including, but not limited to incident, problem, and change control procedures.
* Other projects or duties as assigned.


**Required Skills And Experience**
* Bachelor’s degree in any field and 1+ years working experience and proficiency with planning, designing, supporting, maintaining, and LAN/WAN/VoIP communications, network hardware such as Cisco routers, Ethernet switches, access points voice gateways & firewalls.
* OR 3+ years of on-the-job experience in these areas in lieu of bachelor’s degree.
* Experience with supporting technologies such as Cisco Voice technologies to include the following: Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM), Cisco Unity Connection (CUC), Cisco Unified Contact Center Express (CUCCX), Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence, and Cisco Unified Border Element (CUBE), Cisco Expressway, Cisco Video System, and Webex Control Hub and suite.
* Experience with Voice related protocols (SIP, RTP/SRTP, SDP, MGCP, SCCP etc.); SIP/PSTN Design and Voice Gateway Configuration. Detailed knowledge and understanding of telephony/UC protocols, H323, SIP, T38, TLS and Codecs
* Familiar with technology such as: Wireless (WiFi) 802.11 a/b/g/n technologies, Network security/VPN/SSL technologies, such as Cisco, Palo Alto, Cisco Nexus platforms
* Knowledge of network architecture and maintenance, such as log analysis, backup/recovery, high availability, capacity planning, and DR/resiliency.
* Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong technical support, problem solving, and critical thinking skills.
* Ability to collaborate effectively across teams in a high performing and matrixed team environment.


 Additional information
   

  

 The minimum gross wage according to the collective agreement (chemical industry) for your new job is EUR 3.909,67. We strive to adapt your salary to your range of tasks and to your profile, which is why we are ready to pay wages higher than collectively agreed. This is a legal requirement in Austria which is not applicable for other sites.

title: Product Engineer
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

*Do you want to apply your technical skills in product development, change management and problem solving and do you like high speed and see yourself as a team player? If so, this is a great opportunity to work on everything a current product team encounters!*
*Since the beginning of the 2000s, Scania has had a joint venture with Cummins for the development and manufacture of common-rail fuel systems. The production of these systems is located in Juarez, Mexico and in Södertälje. Product development has primarily taken place in Columbus, USA, but since autumn 2017 we have the new product development and current product support for our fuel systems plant in Södertälje. This is to be able to offer better support and get closer to our current and future European customers and suppliers. The mission for Cummins Fuel Systems Sweden is to develop high and low pressure fuel pumps and injectors for existing and future customers within the Scania/Traton group.*
 Your role
   

  

 As a product engineer, your main task is to act as a support function for production and product development, a kind of onsite product expert who understands our complex products and can perform consequence analyzes in case of deviations. The work takes place cross-functionally together with other support functions, as well as with the production unit. The assignments are very dynamic and constantly changing, with a global network that gives the opportunity to work closely with our colleagues in the US and Mexico, where the corresponding team is located locally.
   

  

 Your duties as a product engineer will also include:
   

  

  

* Conduct thorough analysis of product deviations across internal production, end-customer feedback, field data, and engine unit performance (DE).
* Provide data-driven recommendations to the production team based on comprehensive analysis of measurement data and alignment with specification requirements.
